intro: Psychotria truncata, commonly known as the scarlet psychotria, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and are known for their vivid colors and strong scent. Psychotria truncata is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, such as cocaine, in its leaves.
